name: poke-ball
description: Used in battle :   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 1×.      If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

name: great-ball
description: Used in battle :   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 1.5×.      If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

name: ultra-ball
description: Used in battle :   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 2×.      If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

name: master-ball
description: Used in battle :   Catches a wild Pokémon without fail.      If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

name: premier-ball
description: Used in battle :   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 1×.      If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

name: luxury-ball
description: Used in battle :   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 1×.  Whenever the caught Pokémon's happiness increases, it increases by one extra point.      If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

name: timer-ball
description: Used in battle :   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon.  Has a catch rate of 1.1× on the first turn of the battle and increases by 0.1× every turn, to a maximum of 4× on turn 30.      If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

name: quick-ball
description: Used in battle :   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 4× on the first turn of a battle, but 1× any other time.      If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

name: dusk-ball
description: Used in battle :   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon.  If it's currently nighttime or the wild Pokémon was encountered while walking in a cave, this ball has a catch rate of 3.5×.  Otherwise, it has a catch rate of 1×.      If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

name: heal-ball
description: Used in battle :   Attempts to catch a wild Pokémon, using a catch rate of 1×.  The caught Pokémon's HP is immediately restored, PP for all its moves is restored, and any status ailment is cured.      If used in a trainer battle, nothing happens and the ball is lost.

name: potion
description: Used on a friendly Pokémon :   Restores 20 HP.

name: super-potion
description: Used on a party Pokémon :   Restores 50 HP.

name: hyper-potion
description: Used on a party Pokémon :   Restores 200 HP.

name: max-potion
description: Used on a party Pokémon :   Restores HP to full.

name: full-restore
description: Used on a party Pokémon :   Restores HP to full and cures any status ailment and confusion.

name: antidote
description: Used on a party Pokémon :   Cures poison.

name: burn-heal
description: Used on a party Pokémon :   Cures a burn.

name: ice-heal
description: Used on a party Pokémon :   Cures freezing.

name: awakening
description: Used on a party Pokémon :   Cures sleep.

name: paralyze-heal
description: Used on a party Pokémon :   Cures paralysis.

name: full-heal
description: Used on a party Pokémon :   Cures any status ailment and confusion.

name: revive
description: Used on a party Pokémon :   Revives the Pokémon and restores half its HP.

name: max-revive
description: Used on a party Pokémon :   Revives the Pokémon and restores its HP to full.

name: fresh-water
description: Used on a party Pokémon :   Restores 50 HP.

name: soda-pop
description: Used on a party Pokémon :   Restores 60 HP.

name: lemonade
description: Used on a party Pokémon :   Restores 80 HP.

name: moomoo-milk
description: Used on a party Pokémon :   Restores 100 HP.

name: oran-berry
description: Held in battle :   When the holder has 1/2 its max HP remaining or less, it consumes this item to restore 10 HP.  Used on a party Pokémon :   Restores 10 HP.

name: sitrus-berry
description: Held in battle :   When the holder has 1/2 its max HP remaining or less, it consumes this item to restore 1/4 its max HP.  Used on a party Pokémon :   Restores 1/4 the Pokémon's max HP.

name: chesto-berry
description: Used on a party Pokémon :   Increases happiness by 10/5/2.  Lowers Special Attack effort by 10.

name: pecha-berry
description: Used on a party Pokémon :   Increases happiness by 10/5/2.  Lowers Special Defense effort by 10.

name: rawst-berry
description: Used on a party Pokémon :   Increases happiness by 10/5/2.  Lowers Speed effort by 10.

name: aspear-berry
description: No effect; only useful for planting and cooking.

name: leppa-berry
description: No effect; only useful for planting and cooking.
